column4: Hi, trying to update ubuntu 12-4, supposedly long-term support, fails on this url:
The site *does* have *ubuntu-.2* but does *not* have *ubuntu-.1*
thanks, how do I do that?
ri You can do that in synaptic, e.g.
You can do that in synaptic, e.g.
oh ok i'll bring up synaptic and try updating from there
I guess I need to install synaptic, it apparently doesn't come with the default distro
Yes, but thats not a big deal :)

synaptic apparently doesn't have a way to specify mirrors.  Would you mind having a look yourself for that particular url I specified, to see if you can find it on any mirror?  I did a synaptic update and got the same problem.
that's good to know.  Is it a gui thing (and if so, what dropdown menu?) or do I need to give some option to a command-line invocation?
Take a look at Settings -> Repositories -> Download from
There, you can choose the mirror you want to use.
thanks for your help, all are updated now.
